string-array.name: short_descriptions
string-array.item: Matsya, the fish, from the Satya Yuga.
Kurma, the tortoise, from the Satya Yuga.
Varaha, the boar, from the Satya Yuga.
Narasimha, the half-man/half-lion, from the Satya Yuga
Vamana, the dwarf, from the Treta Yuga.
Parashurama, warrior with the axe, from the Treta Yuga.
Rama, the prince and king of Ayodhya, from the Treta Yuga.
Krishna was the eighth son of Devaki and Vasudev, from the Dwapara Yuga.
Buddha: Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, is generally included as an avatar of Vishnu in Hinduism.
Kalki ("Eternity", or "White Horse", or "Destroyer of Filth"), will be the final incarnation of Vishnu, foretold to appear at the end of Kali Yuga, our present epoch.
